description: Set the value of clump attributes. This command is a synonym for the clump initialize command. Individual attributes can be listed with the clump list command and all attributes can be visualized. Clump attributes are characteristics of the clumps such as position or size. These are distinct from clump properties (assigned with the clump property command) that are surface properties of the clumps that are used to fill contact model properties.

keywords.name: damp
keywords.description: Clump local damping coefficient where f > 0. Default: 0

keywords.name: density
keywords.description: Clump density where f > 0. Default: 0

keywords.name: displacement
keywords.description: Accumulated clump displacement vector as a result of cycling

keywords.name: displacement-x/y/z
keywords.description: Component of accumulated clump displacement as a result of cycling

keywords.name: euler-x/y/z
keywords.description: Euler angle (in degrees) of current clump orientation (3D ONLY). Updated only when orientation tracking is enabled

keywords.name: force-applied
keywords.description: Force vector applied to clumps (constant applied force, not updated during cycling)

keywords.name: force-contact
keywords.description: Sum of contact force accumulated during previous force-displacement update. Modified during next update

keywords.name: force-contact-x/y/z
keywords.description: Component of the contact force

keywords.name: fragment
keywords.description: Fragment ID (see Fragment documentation)

keywords.name: moi-11/12/13/22/23/33
keywords.description: Component of clump real moment of inertia tensor. When modified, only principal moments are changed. Sets moments to fixed state (not auto-updated when scaling/changing volume/density). Fix state modifiable via FISH (clump.moi.fix)

keywords.name: moi-principal
keywords.description: Real principal moments of inertia (3D ONLY). When modified, only principal moments are changed. Sets moments to fixed state (not auto-updated when scaling/changing volume/density). Fix state modifiable via FISH (clump.moi.fix)

keywords.name: moment-applied
keywords.description: Moment applied to clumps (y- and z-components 3D ONLY)

keywords.name: moment-applied-x/y/z
keywords.description: Component of moment applied to clumps (3D ONLY)

keywords.name: moment-contact
keywords.description: Sum of contact moments accumulated during previous force-displacement update (y- and z-components 3D ONLY). Modified during next update

keywords.name: moment-contact-x/y/z
keywords.description: Component of the contact moment (3D ONLY)

keywords.name: position
keywords.description: Location of clump centroid

keywords.name: position-x/y/z
keywords.description: Component of the location of clump centroids

keywords.name: rotation
keywords.description: Current clump orientation (2D ONLY). Updated only when orientation tracking is enabled

keywords.name: spin
keywords.description: Clump angular velocity in radians per second (y- and z-components 3D ONLY)

keywords.name: spin-x/y/z
keywords.description: Component of clump angular velocity in radians per second (3D ONLY)

keywords.name: velocity
keywords.description: Clump translational velocity vector

keywords.name: velocity-x/y/z
keywords.description: Component of the clump velocity

keywords.name: volume
keywords.description: Clump volume. When modified, only mass and real mass are changed (not moment of inertia or pebble sizes). Sets moments to fixed state. Fix state modifiable via FISH (clump.moi.fix)

modifiers.name: gradient
modifiers.description: Apply linear gradient in each axis direction starting at origin

modifiers.name: gradient-x/y/z
modifiers.description: Apply linear gradient in specific direction starting at origin

notes: Modification of clump geometry will fail if the resulting clump would not fall entirely within the model domain
Be aware of the distinction between attributes and properties! See tutorial 'Attributes and Properties' for details
Specifying moment of inertia or volume via command line sets them to fixed state (not auto-updated when scaling/changing density)

examples.description: Set density to 1000 and local damping coefficient to 0.7 for all clumps (most common usage)
Set velocity for clump with ID 102
Apply constant force to clumps in group (not updated during cycling)

examples.command: clump attribute volume 0.5 multiply 1.2 range id 1 100
examples.description: Multiply volume by 1.2 for clumps with ID 1-100 (sets moment of inertia to fixed state)

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: Use Clump.set_*() methods (e.g., Clump.set_density(), Clump.set_vel(), Clump.set_pos()) - requires iteration over clump range
